image.altText: Houses in Brisbane street

props.synopsis: National home prices are losing momentum, new data shows, and anticipated interest rate cuts are unlikely to stop falls in house prices next year.

title.children: 'A strain on households': Property market continues to lose steam and house price falls are expected for 2025

image.altText: Rooftop solar in Perth's southern suburbs

props.synopsis: With the rise and rise of rooftop solar showing no signs of stopping in Australia, the market operator says "emergency" powers to control it are urgently needed.

title.children: Market operator seeks emergency powers to switch off panels as solar tsunami 'threatens wipeout'

image.altText: A composite image of Kim Jong Un, Donald Trump and Elon Musk.

props.synopsis: When Donald Trump re-enters the White House on January 20, he will find that Kim Jong Un, the man he so enjoyed meeting, has built for himself a new international status – and is now a major ally of Vladimir Putin.

title.children: Trump now has two 'rocket men' in his life – and one has really come up in the world

image.altText: The Roblox app displayed on a smartphone screen with a Roblox logo in the background.

props.synopsis: Roblox is one of the most popular platforms in the world, but there are increasing concerns over the ability for users to message each other directly through games, with young children being lured off-platform and exposed to disturbing content.

title.children: 'Very naive': Mum's warning after her nine-year-old was targeted by a predator on Roblox

props.synopsis: As more cracks appear in the burgeoning super industry, performance won't take centre stage. The trust gap will.

title.children: A new battleground is starting to open up over superannuation

image.altText: Albanese sits at the centre table in parliament, frowning as he looks up from paperwork

props.synopsis: In an ominous sign for the government, new research shows dissatisfaction with the direction of the country is at the same level as it was just before the Morrison government lost the election.

title.children: There's one statistic that can give us a hint about next year's election result

image.altText: A couple smiles.

props.synopsis: A couple found dead at their takeaway shop in Sydney's west have been identified as Hoa Tek Chiem and Kim Heang Gau.

title.children: 'I pray you both rest': Couple allegedly murdered at Western Sydney takeaway shop identified

image.altText: The exterior of an old wooden hut surrounded by bush.

props.synopsis: Halls Hut is about as isolated as you can get in Australia's wilderness. A heli-tourism proponent will seek federal approval to fix it up, but is facing extensive opposition from bushwalkers, fly-fishers and environmental groups over the use of a helicopter.

title.children: It's a hut, on an island, in a lake, in the wilderness. Its upkeep has now become a political issue

image.altText: An Indian/South Asian man with black facial hair speaks onstage wearing a light suit jacket with American flags behind him

props.synopsis: The incoming president has picked a long-term ally who has previously pledged to "shut down" the US federal intelligence agency.

title.children: Trump singles out loyalist Kash Patel to lead FBI

image.altText: Three different petrol station signs with prices on the board

props.synopsis: When it's time to fill up with petrol, paying extra at the pump can be financially costly. We've done the legwork for you and dispelled the myths about what controls prices and how they're determined.

title.children: Cheap Tuesdays are a 'thing of the past' but shopping around can help motorists save at the petrol pump

image.altText: 19-year-old girl witih hair in braids and white top looks out to distance

props.synopsis: The major parties are united on the need to protect young people by banning them from social media. But experts say dialling back something that has become so pervasive in the lives of children and teenagers requires nuance — and more time — to get right.

title.children: As Australia enters uncharted territory, experts are mixed on whether banning social media will help or hinder

image.altText: A close up image of a woman with black hair and ear peircing

props.synopsis: Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke says he rejected Israeli right-wing politician Ayelet Shaked's application to come to Australia over concerns she would threaten social cohesion.

title.children: Home affairs minister details 'hard line' that led to a former Israeli minister's visa being denied

image.altText: Floodwaters rush along a city street.

props.synopsis: Much of Queensland will continue to experience humid conditions, with the sticky feeling expected to hang around — whether it's raining or not — and the south-east warned of possible thunderstorms.

title.children: Flash flooding in parts of Queensland as BOM predicts more storms, rainfall and humidity

image.altText: A screenshot of the face of a man in a video.

props.synopsis: Hamas has released a video of an Israeli-American hostage on Saturday, in which he pleads for US President-elect Donald Trump to secure his release.

title.children: Hamas releases hostage video as Israeli strikes kill 15 in Gaza

image.altText: Lewis Hamilton driving his F1 Mercedes with sparks flying from a tyre puncture

props.synopsis: A rouge mirror and the failure of race officials to clear it off the track has been deemed "dangerous" for a former world champion, and blown Formula 1's constructors' championship wide open.

title.children: 'Dangerous' inaction causes chaos in Qatar as Norris penalty blows constructors' championship open

image.altText: Ian Redpath sits in his whites with his feet up in the changerooms while having a drink in 1976

props.synopsis: Ian Redpath, the unflappable opener of 66 Tests and member of the Australian cricket hall of fame, dies aged 83.

title.children: Ian Redpath, stoic Australian Test opener and hall of fame member, dies aged 83

image.altText: Aline Gomes Amaro and Sham Freier collide as they compete for a header

props.synopsis: The Matildas have fallen short of a comeback against Brazil in their second international friendly on the Gold Coast, going down 2-1 in a physical encounter.

title.children: Spirited Matildas fall short of physical Brazil in 2-1 friendly defeat

image.altText: TFS crews near a red ship.

props.synopsis: An area of Hobart's waterfront was cordoned off on Sunday because of a jet fuel spill, with fire crews seen near Australia's Antarctic icebreaker Nuyina.

title.children: Jet fuel spill shuts part of Hobart's waterfront, with people told to close windows due to hazardous materials

image.altText: Female Tasmania Police officer with breathalyser at random testing station

props.synopsis: After being arrested the first time, the Deloraine woman was disqualified from driving for two years, but that allegedly did not stop her getting back behind the wheel again the following day.

title.children: Tasmanian woman caught driving five times over legal limit — twice in 12 hours

image.altText: A soldier waves from an army-khaki vehicle on a road surrounded by damaged houses and short shrubs

props.synopsis: A shock four-day offensive in Syria's north-east has seen territory held by the Assad regime since 2016 retaken by militant groups aiming to overthrow the government.

title.children: 'Game-changing' advances in Syria's civil war as government withdraws

image.altText: A rescue crewman looking out of a helicopter over a mountain.

props.synopsis: Two tourists who became lost while hiking at Cape Hillsborough National Park in north Queensland have been found during a large-scale search.

title.children: Tourists who became lost on bushwalk found by helicopter in major search operation

image.altText: Rows of houses and streets line a village with mountains in the background.

props.synopsis: Americans unhappy with the US election result are being encouraged to move to Italy. But will anyone take up the offer?

title.children: A home on an Italian island can be bought for only 1 euro — but there are some catches

image.altText: Jiyai Shin smiles as people pour water on her head in celebration

props.synopsis: South Korea's Riyai Shin holds through a nervy final stretch to win her second Australian Open, while unheralded American Ryggs Johnston shocks the field to lift the Stonehaven Cup.

title.children: Shin holds on for Australian Open triumph as unheralded American breaks Aussie hearts

image.altText: A hand holds a smooth chocolate  bar

props.synopsis: A 34-year-old British man has thought his unwrinkled chocolate bar was a new cost-cutting measure. After sharing the find, he's been handed £2 in compensation.

title.children: Smooth chocolate bar wins British man £2 in compensation after viral post

image.altText: Red firecrackers go off in front of police guards.

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands of demonstrators gathered outside the parliament, throwing stones and setting off fireworks.

title.children: More than 40 people hospitalised in Georgia during protests over suspension of EU talks

image.altText: A photo of a white car with blasted windows and doors.

props.synopsis: The food charity says it is pausing its operations in Gaza after a vehicle carrying its staff members was hit by an Israeli air strike.

title.children: Israeli military says it was targeting Hamas 'terrorist' in strike that reportedly killed three World Central Kitchen aid workers

image.altText: A graphic artwork of a man in a suit with his eyes obscured, with cameras and a large building also visible in the background

props.synopsis: Being a secret agent might seem like a glamorous job, but agencies in the West are struggling to attract the next generation of spies due to many young people prioritising issues such as climate change and COVID-19 over national security.

title.children: Britain and Australia have a spy shortage and recruiting the next generation is proving difficult

image.altText: Selina Middleton EDITED

props.synopsis: Methylamphetamine is taking a toll on the central Kimberley town of Fitzroy Crossing. It is a story playing out across Australia's top end.

title.children: Cheaper than grog and marijuana, meth is wreaking havoc on this small town

image.altText: Blue tarp can be seen at the side of the factory outside Vientiane, Laos

props.synopsis: A Laos government document obtained by the ABC suggests the source of a methanol poisoning outbreak that killed six tourists is a rundown factory outside of Vientiane that was making vodka and whisky.

title.children: Laos government document points to rundown factory as source of methanol poisoning

image.altText: Loyal Wingman plane in flight

props.synopsis: The Future Fund currently holds more than half a billion dollars worth of shares in weapons manufacturers and war-related companies, but is it time we all started talking about its larger legacy, and the nature of its "wealth" we plan to hand to future Australians?

title.children: Australia's Future Fund invests in the global arms industry. Are the returns worth it?

image.altText: A woman in a yellow top and teens clutches her stomach on a couch

props.synopsis: Visanne, also known by the generic name dienogest, will have its cost reduced from more than $800 per year for a course of daily tablets to $380 per year, or around $90 per year for pension and concession card holders.

title.children: Endometriosis treatment to be listed on PBS for the first time in 30 years

image.altText: An image of Canada Water's bright red boardwalk along the water, with the development in the background.

props.synopsis: Australia's biggest super fund has invested millions of dollars into a London development, which will deliver homes, workspaces and a retail precinct in London at the same time Australia's housing crisis is in full swing.

title.children: A new town centre in London promises to build 3,000 homes. It's being partly funded by everyday Australians' super

image.altText: Melbourne Renegades players celebrate in a group as Laura Harris walks off

props.synopsis: West Indies star Hayley Matthews fires with bat and ball against Brisbane Heat at the MCG, powering the Melbourne Renegades to their maiden WBBL title.

title.children: Matthews leads Renegades to WBBL title in rain-affected MCG final against Heat

image.altText: An ice climber carefully strikes the wall of ice with his ice axe.

props.synopsis: Ice climbing, introduced to Australia by migrants in the 1960s, is booming as extreme sport lovers seek higher thrills — but with such a short season, you have to book early.

title.children: 'You wouldn't believe it's Australia': Climbing walls of ice in our own backyard
